title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a Java class using ajc command with the subpackage\Test.java file as input, a directory named "subpackage" is created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: When compiling a Java class using ajc command with the subpackage\Test.java file as input, a directory named "subpackage" should not be created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:

1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Run the command 'ajc subpackage\Test.java' to compile the class.
